intro.p: Let T:\mathbb R^5\to\mathbb R^4 be the transformation with standard matrix A, where A={{matrix}}\sim{{rref}}=\mathrm{RREF}\,A
Answer each of the following questions, providing a detailed enough explanation that it's clear your solution isn't a guess.

content.p: Find the solution set of the following system. {{system}}
Explain why the set S={{columns}} does or does not span \mathbb R^4 by discussing a relevant vector equation.

outtro.p: The vector equation \cdots=\vec w {{#surj}}always has solutions{{/surj}}{{^surj}}may cause a contradiction{{/surj}}, so the set {{#surj}}spans{{/surj}}{{^surj}}does not span{{/surj}}.

content.p: Explain why the set S={{columns}} is linearly independent or dependent by discussing a relevant vector equation.

outtro.p: The vector equation \cdots=\vec 0 has infinitely-many solutions so the set is linearly dependent.

content.p: Explain why the set S={{columns}} is or is not a basis for \mathbb R^4 by discussing spanning and independence.

outtro.p: The set is not a basis because it is not independent. {{^surj}}It's also not a basis because it does not span \mathbb R^4.{{/surj}}

content.p: Explain why the collection {{polys}} of polynomials is linearly independent or linearly dependent by discussing two isomorphic vector spaces.

outtro.p: The vector space \mathcal P^3 is isomorphic to \mathbb R^4. So the collection is linearly dependent because the isomorphic set of vectors studied earlier is linearly dependent.

content.p: Explain why T is or is not surjective, and is or is not injective, by inspecting rows and columns of an appropriate matrix.
Find bases for the image and kernel of T, and use them to verify the rank-nullity theorem for T.

Suppose A is a 4\times 4 matrix where \mathrm{det}\,A={{det}}. Let B be the matrix obtained by applying the row operation {{op}} to A. Explain and demonstrate how to find \mathrm{det}B by modeling the row operation as matrix multiplication.
